type.name: section
type.title: The Buxton scholarship fund.
type.context: BUXTON SCHOLARSHIP ACT under The Buxton scholarship fund. 2. (1) The amount of two thousand and fifty-eight dollars, raised by public subscription for the purpose of providing scholarships for competition by children of the Buxton and Friendship village district, together with all property hereafter acquired in addition thereto for the same purpose, shall be called the Buxton scholarship fund (in this Act referred to as the fund).  (2) The fund shall be vested in trustees, hereafter in this Act referred to as the trustees, who shall hold it in trust LAWS OF GUYANA 4 Cap. 39:06 Buxton Scholarship  L.R.O. 1/2012             Schedule.      Trustees of the fund, their appointment and powers.                               for the purposes of this Act and award scholarships for competition by children of the Buxton and Friendship village district, and, out of the income of the fund, pay the cost of the scholarships they award from time to time, and make any other payments they have authority to make.   (3) The trustees shall administer the fund, shall award scholarships, and may make other payments of money, in accordance with this Act and the Buxton Scholarship Regulations set out in the Schedule.

type.name: section
type.title: Trustees of the fund, their appointment and powers.
type.context: BUXTON SCHOLARSHIP ACT under Trustees of the fund, their appointment and powers. 3. (1) The trustees shall be not more than five nor less than three in number, and shall be styled The Trustees of the Buxton Scholarship Fund, and they may sue and be sued in that name.  (2) The Minister shall appoint the first trustees, and upon the publication in the Gazette of the appointment all moneys and property comprising the fund shall thereupon vest in the trustees, and the fund shall be paid to them within two weeks from that publication.  (3) On the death, resignation, or absence without leave from Guyana for four months, of any trustee the Minister may appoint someone to be trustee to take his place.  (4) During the absence from Guyana of a trustee, the Minister may appoint a person to act as trustee.  (5) The Minister shall appoint one of the trustees to be chairman, who shall hold office for three years but may be re-appointed, and he shall preside at all meetings of trustees at which he is present; in the absence of the chairman the trustees present at a meeting shall elect one of their number to preside at that meeting.  (6) The trustees may acquire and dispose of property for the purposes of the fund and make investments LAWS OF GUYANA Buxton Scholarship Cap. 39:06 5                           Amendment or revocation of regulations.              Establishment of scholarship.     Value.      of the fund in any securities in which trustees are by law authorised to invest, and also on the security of immovable property in Guyana to an amount not exceeding two-thirds of the value of the property.  (7) All acts shall be valid and binding if performed by three trustees.  (8) The Trustees shall keep proper books of account of their receipts and expenditure, which shall be subject to the examination of the Auditor-General, and shall annually make a report of their transactions and accounts to the Minister.  (9) The Minister may at any time revoke the appointment of a trustee.  (10) The appointment, and the revocation of the appointment, of a trustee shall be notified in the Gazette.
